# SCAR Antarctic Digital Database (ADD) Metadata Toolbox - Updating existing records

Follow this workflow to update an existing record (for example to correct information).

**Note:** You will need *author* rights to update metadata records and *editor* rights to re-publish them for others
to see.

## Overview

This sequence diagram shows how the overall process to update, re-publish and view an existing record/item:

[![](https://mermaid.-QTogVXBkYXRlIHJlY29yZFxuICBBLT4-QzogUmUtSW1wb3J0IHJlY29yZFxuICBDLT4-VTogUmVjb3JkIHVwZGF0ZWRcblx0QS0-PkM6IFJlLVB1Ymxpc2ggcmVjb3JkXG4gIFUtPj5DOiBSZWNvcmQgcmV0cmlldmVkXG4gIEMtPj5QOiBSZWNvcmQgdXBkYXRlZFxuICBBLT4-QzogQnVpbGQgaXRlbSBwYWdlc1xuICBQLT4-QzogUmVjb3JkcyByZXRyaWV2ZWRcbiAgQS0-PkM6IEJ1aWxkIHJlY29yZCBwYWdlc1xuICBQLT4-QzogUmVjb3JkcyByZXRyaWV2ZWRcbiAgQS0-PlM6IFB1Ymxpc2ggc3RhdGljIHNpdGVcbiAgVi0-)](https://mermaid-js.github.io/mermaid-live-editor/#-QTogVXBkYXRlIHJlY29yZFxuICBBLT4-QzogUmUtSW1wb3J0IHJlY29yZFxuICBDLT4-VTogUmVjb3JkIHVwZGF0ZWRcblx0QS0-PkM6IFJlLVB1Ymxpc2ggcmVjb3JkXG4gIFUtPj5DOiBSZWNvcmQgcmV0cmlldmVkXG4gIEMtPj5QOiBSZWNvcmQgdXBkYXRlZFxuICBBLT4-QzogQnVpbGQgaXRlbSBwYWdlc1xuICBQLT4-QzogUmVjb3JkcyByZXRyaWV2ZWRcbiAgQS0-PkM6IEJ1aWxkIHJlY29yZCBwYWdlc1xuICBQLT4-QzogUmVjb3JkcyByZXRyaWV2ZWRcbiAgQS0-PlM6IFB1Ymxpc2ggc3RhdGljIHNpdGVcbiAgVi0-)

1. the user signs-into the metadata editor
2. a JSON file defining the record is exported from the metadata editor
3. the metadata editor retrieves the imported record from the unpublished repository
4. the JSON file is updated as needed
5. the JSON file defining the record is re-imported into the metadata editor
6. the metadata editor updates the update record in the unpublished repository
7. the updated record is re-published
8. the metadata editor retrieves the updated record from the unpublished repository
9. the metadata editor updates the updated record in the published repository
10. records are built as items as static HTML pages
11. records are retrieved from the published repository
12. records are built as styled XML files
13. records are retrieved from the published repository
14. static HTML pages and XML files are published to the static site
15. visitors can access the updated record and item page through the static site

## Steps

1. run [`auth sign-in`](command-reference.md#auth-sign-in)
1. run [`records export`](command-reference.md#records-export)
2. update record file as needed
3. run [`records import --allow-update --publish --allow-republish`](command-reference.md#records-import)
2. run [`site build-items`](command-reference.md#site-build-collections)
3. run [`site build-records`](command-reference.md#site-build-collections)
3. run [`site publish`](command-reference.md#site-publish)
